title: Array Reduction
statementHtml:
You are given an array aa containing nn integers.

In one operation, you can choose some elements from this array and remove them. However, the elements you choose must meet one of the following conditions:

Note that if you choose only 11 element to remove, it automatically meets these conditions.

For example, if a={1,2,1,1,3}a={1,2,1,1,3}, some of the possible elements you can remove in one operation are:

However, you cannot choose the 22-nd, the 33-rd and the 44-th element because the 22-nd element is not equal to the 44-th, but the 33-rd element is equal to the 44-th.

For each xx from 00 to n−1n−1, you have to calculate the minimum number of operations required to decrease the size of the array to exactly xx.
inputSpecHtml:
The first line contains one integer tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of two lines:

  • the first line contains one integer nn (1≤n≤3⋅1051≤n≤3⋅105) — the size of the array;
  • the second line contains nn integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an (1≤ai≤n1≤ai≤n) — the array itself.

Additional constraint on the input: the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 3⋅1053⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, print nn integers c0,c1,…,cn−1c0,c1,…,cn−1, where cici is the minimum number of operations required to reduce the size of the array to exactly ii.
noteHtml:
In the first example, the answer can be obtained as follows:

  • c0=3c0=3: remove a8,a9,a10,a11a8,a9,a10,a11; then remove a1,a2,a3,a4a1,a2,a3,a4; then remove a5,a6,a7a5,a6,a7;
  • c1=3c1=3: remove a8,a9,a10,a11a8,a9,a10,a11; then remove a1,a2,a3,a4a1,a2,a3,a4; then remove a5,a6a5,a6;
  • c2=2c2=2: remove a7,a8,a9,a10,a11a7,a8,a9,a10,a11; then remove a1,a2,a3,a4a1,a2,a3,a4;
  • c3=2c3=2: remove a7,a8,a9,a10,a11a7,a8,a9,a10,a11; then remove a1,a2,a3a1,a2,a3;
  • c4=2c4=2: remove a7,a8,a9,a10,a11a7,a8,a9,a10,a11; then remove a1,a2a1,a2;
  • c5=1c5=1: remove a1,a7,a8,a9,a10,a11a1,a7,a8,a9,a10,a11;
  • c6=1c6=1: remove a7,a8,a9,a10,a11a7,a8,a9,a10,a11;
  • c7=1c7=1: remove a1,a2,a3,a4a1,a2,a3,a4;
  • c8=1c8=1: remove a1,a2,a3a1,a2,a3;
  • c9=1c9=1: remove a1,a2a1,a2;
  • c10=1c10=1: remove a7a7;
